page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {Place Name} In Gaelic Durness is spelt Diuranais. It is thought to mean black point. Dur meaning black (of the peat) and Ness a point (Farraid Head). {The Clearances} When the clearances took place last century,many people were thrown out of their homes, so that there was more land for sheep. There are still ruins of the little croft houses on the rocky land at Sangobeg where the people were forced to live. {Durness Hotel}This large building stood in the Square and was burnt down in 1908.The walls stood until the late 1950's when it was demolished. {Sangomore Smithy}Built in 1910 using stones and slates from the Durness Hotel.Inside is the furnace and large leather bellows.It is only used very occasionally today.
